faq.title: What types of Latin dance classes do you offer?
faq.text: We specialize in salsa and bachata, offering classes for various skill levels â€“ from beginners to advanced dancers.

faq.title: Do I need a partner to join a class?
faq.text: No partner is required to join our classes. We encourage individual sign-ups and facilitate partner rotation during the class.

faq.title: What should I wear to a Latin dance class?
faq.text: Comfortable clothing that allows for movement is recommended. For footwear, dance shoes or shoes with a smooth sole are ideal.

faq.title: I'm a beginner. Will I be able to keep up?
faq.text: Absolutely! Our beginner classes are designed to introduce the basics at a comfortable pace. Everyone is welcome, regardless of experience.

faq.title: How long does it take to learn salsa/bachata?
faq.text: The learning time varies depending on the individual. Consistent practice is key, and most students feel confident with the basics after a few classes.

faq.title: Are there any age restrictions for joining the classes?
faq.text: Our classes are open to adults of all ages.

faq.title: Can I attend classes if I have no previous dance experience?
faq.text: Yes, our beginner classes are perfect for those with no previous dance experience.

faq.title: How do I reserve my spot for a class?
faq.text: You can sign up through our website, turnin up to one of our classes or by contacting us directly via phone or email.

faq.title: What is the cost of a class?
faq.text: The cost varies depending on the type of class and package options. Please refer to our pricing page for detailed information:

faq.title: Do you offer private lessons?
faq.text: Yes, we offer private lessons for individuals or small groups. Please contact us for more details and scheduling.

faq.title: Do you offer gift certificates?
faq.text: Yes, we offer gift certificates for all of our classes. Please contact us for more details.

faq.title: Do I need to rotate partners in the lessons?
faq.text: As Salsa and Bachata are very social dances, we do ask everyone to rotate during our classes to ensure everyone has a turn and helps you become a better dancer.
